item.title: Poke Sallet
item.description: “… probably the best known and most widely used wild vegetable in America.” Euell Gibbons (needs verification) Characteristics, Ecology, History Phytolacca americana Phytolaccin Native to North America (also possibly found in Africa) Appalachian staple Associated with poor, rural south (e.g. “Poke Salad Annie”) Exported to Europe as an ornamental Used by the Algonquin for dye Civil War Era Letters possibly written in Pokeberry ink Pigeon Berry Eaten in large quantities by passenger pigeons
